Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is contradicted by archived versions of President Trump's Facebook page, which show the "political candidate" designation has been used for months.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Facebook did not change the designation after Trump lost the election.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that the page still says Trump is the "45th President of the United States."
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider the alternative explanation that the designation of "political candidate" is determined by whoever manages the page, in this case, someone from Trump's campaign committee.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by suggesting that Facebook's actions demonstrate bias against Trump, when in fact, the designation has been consistent for months.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that Trump will remain the president until inauguration day, despite the election being called for his opponent.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting a screenshot of the verified Facebook page that lists Trump as a "political candidate," but fails to acknowledge the other information on the page that indicates he is the 45th President of the United States.
